channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Hospitalizations near out of control as cases surge
Civil rights legend Rep. John Lewis dead at 80
Tributes flow for civil rights icon John Lewis
Will Trump send his son back to school? See Kellyanne Conway's response
item.description: White House senior adviser Kellyanne Conway says it will be a personal decision by President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump whether they decide to send their teenage son back to school during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Fire breaks out at Nantes Cathedral in France
item.description: A fire broke out in a cathedral in the western French city of Nantes, according to regional firefighters on Saturday, 15 months after a blaze tore through Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.

item.title: Britain is too weak to go full Trump on China
item.description: When the UK announced its U-turn on allowing the Chinese telecoms giant Huawei to play a part in the country's 5G network, it signaled an end to the so-called "golden era" of UK-China relations. To the delight of US President Donald Trump, the UK would seemingly no longer equivocate on its national security in order to balance its relationship with China -- and would instead adopt something closer to a US-style hard line.

item.title: Bollywood superstar Aishwarya Rai Bachchan hospitalized after testing positive for Covid-19
Birx's rise in the Trump administration has tainted her reputation among some health experts
item.description: As the relationship between Dr. Anthony Fauci and President Donald Trump publicly disintegrated over the past few months, Dr. Deborah Birx, Fauci's former mentee, solidified her standing inside the White House, to the point that sources familiar with the situation say she has essentially taken charge of running the task force day to day.

item.title: Mary Trump says President 'is not going to get better'
item.description: • Analysis: The signs of a Democratic landslide are everywhere

item.title: She went from a coronavirus diagnosis to dying in her daughter's arms in a matter of days
The signs of a Democratic landslide are everywhere
item.description: With just more than 100 days left before the 2020 election, there are an increasing number of red flags that suggest Republicans are headed toward a disastrous result at the ballot box this fall.

item.title: White House moves portraits of Clinton and George W. Bush to rarely used room
item.description: The official portraits of former Presidents Bill Clinton and George W. Bush were removed from the Grand Foyer of the White House within the last week, aides told CNN, and replaced by those of two Republican presidents who served more than a century ago.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Mysterious arrest video with unidentified police raises questions
item.description: A mysterious video of unidentified police arresting a protester and putting him in an unmarked vehicle has been shared widely online, including by a US senator who called it "authoritarianism." US Customs and Border Protection says the person detained in the video was suspected of assaulting federal agents.

item.title: White House blocks CDC from testifying on reopening schools
Weather forecasts are less accurate because of Covid-19, a new study reveals
item.description: As the US heads into peak hurricane season, a reduction in commercial airline flights due to Covid-19 has significantly impacted our ability to accurately forecast the weather.

item.title: Why Silicon Valley's biggest companies are investing billions in India
item.description: Since the start of 2020, the biggest names in US tech have invested around $17 billion in India.

item.title: Tech CEO's assistant charged over his killing and dismemberment
Despite recent anti-Semitic comments, Jews and Black people have long been allies
item.description: I was talking to a Black friend this week about a recent string of anti-Semitic tweets from Black celebrities when he hit me with a question that caught me by surprise.

item.title: I can't shake Covid-19: Warnings from young survivors still suffering
item.description: Daniel Green is still hobbled by the severe viral infection that struck him in March and left him coughing up blood.

item.title: Chicago mayor to White House press secretary: 'Hey, Karen. Watch your mouth'
CNN's Don Lemon is still in disbelief at this Trump quote
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon wonders how anyone believes Donald Trump, saying that the President's own words about downplaying the Covid-19 pandemic should tell people everything they need to know.

item.title: Princess Beatrice, daughter of Prince Andrew, marries in secret ceremony in front of Queen
item.description: Princess Beatrice, the daughter of Prince Andrew and Sarah, Duchess of York, has married her fiancé in a secret wedding at Windsor Castle attended by Queen Elizabeth II.

item.title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg announces cancer recurrence
item.description: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg said Friday she is undergoing chemotherapy to treat a recurrence of cancer. The treatment is yielding "positive results."

item.title: Trump taxes judgment to be issued quickly, Supreme Court says
item.description: The US Supreme Court granted the Manhattan district attorney's request to immediately issue its judgment in the case over President Donald Trump's tax returns, paving the way for new challenges to a grand jury subpoena to be handled by a lower court judge.

item.title: Fatal shot that killed Washington police officer was from his partner
item.description: A police officer killed in a shooting earlier this week in a Seattle suburb was struck by gunfire from a fellow police officer, according to the agency investigating the shooting.

item.title: John King: We thought this was troublesome. You see the trend now
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci said that instead of focusing on a second wave of coronavirus, the US needs to focus on the alarming increase of coronavirus cases happening now.

item.title: NBA star James Harden criticized for wearing Blue Lives Matter face mask
item.description: Houston Rockets shooting guard James Harden is taking some heat on social media for sporting a face mask with a thin blue line, a symbol that represents the Blue Lives Matter non-profit organization.

item.title: A teenager created an anti-racism calendar to make it easier for everyone to become an ally
item.description: A Vermont teen found a way to creatively help others grow into becoming better allies for the people of color in their communities with an anti-racist calendar.

item.title: Spain orders cull of nearly 100,000 farmed mink after positive Covid-19 tests
Florida governor blames media for Florida's Covid-19 response
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar points out the inaccuracies in Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' argument that the media stopped asking about coronavirus in May and is to blame for the public becoming complacent and cases rising.

item.title: Instagram's TikTok clone is going global
item.description: Instagram believes that it can do TikTok better than TikTok — and this August, people will be able to decide for themselves.

item.title: Ancient human ancestors carved a handaxe from a hippo femur 1.4 million years ago, study says
item.description: Early human ancestors used advanced techniques to craft a handaxe from the femur of a hippopotamus 1.4 million years ago, according to a new study.

item.title: Former game show host tweets that his son has Covid-19
item.description: Former game show host Chuck Woolery's son has Covid-19, according to a spokesperson for Woolery. Woolery, who has since deactivated his Twitter account, said in his last posted tweet: "Covid-19 is real and it is here."

item.title: A US travel ban would bar China's top billionaire entrepreneurs from America
item.description: The Trump administration is reportedly considering a ban on travel to the United States by all members of the Chinese Communist Party and their families. That could have major consequences for China's wealthiest entrepreneurs and business leaders.

item.title: Journalist Jemele Hill weighs in on NBA star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's op-ed
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon talks to journalist Jemele Hill about an op-ed penned by former NBA star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar on anti-semitism in sports and Hollywood.

item.title: No, NASA didn't create a 13th zodiac sign
item.description: NASA scientists do not study astrology; nor are they responsible for the creation of a little-known 13th zodiac sign.

item.title: Messi labels Barcelona a 'weak' team following shock defeat
item.description: At the same time Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane was being joyously thrown into the air by his team, Barcelona's dejected players trudged off the pitch at the Camp Nou.

item.title: Watch Tina Fey's pandemic-inspired '30 Rock' special
item.description: Cast members of the beloved NBC sitcom "30 Rock" got back together for a remotely filmed comedy special.

item.title: Ingenuity will be the first helicopter to fly on Mars
item.description: When NASA's Perseverance rover launches at the end of this month, an experiment named Ingenuity will be safely tucked beneath the rover for the seven-month journey. Ingenuity will be the first helicopter to attempt flight on another planet.

item.title: Battling wind and rustiness, Tiger Woods feels 'good' in return to action
item.description: During any normal golf tournament, the words "on the tee, Tiger Woods" are usually followed by rapturous applause from the gathered crowd.

item.title: The thrill of tuk-tuk racing
item.description: Tuk-tuks are three-wheeled motor vehicles widely used in Sri Lanka and southern Asia.

item.title: Island won in a poker game on sale for $17 million
item.description: A fully serviced private island in Australia's Southern Great Barrier Reef is now on the market -- just in time for those who want a place to ride out the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Want to go camping? Follow these Covid-19 safety tips
item.description: "Keep close to Nature's heart ... and break clear away, once in a while, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean." -- Scottish-American natural John Muir

item.title: The US loses two icons of the civil rights movement in one day
item.description: Two towering figures of the American civil rights movement died Friday, a major loss for a nation still grappling with protests and demands for racial equality decades after their struggle.

item.title: Masked, camouflaged federal authorities crack down on protesters in Portland, Oregon
How the massive Twitter hack may have happened
item.description: A group of former Twitter employees who watched in shock as a hack compromised the accounts of some of the most prominent people on the social network, including Barack Obama, Joe Biden and Elon Musk, are among those trying to figure out how an attack of such staggering proportions could have happened. As they conduct their unofficial investigation in a closed Slack group, the former employees, including some who were members of Twitter's security team, are attempting to reconstruct the events leading up to the takeovers based on their knowledge of the social network's internal protocols and technical systems.

item.title: John Lewis, civil rights icon and 'conscious of Congress,' dies at 80
item.description: • LIVE UPDATES Tributes flow in for John Lewis • John Lewis' life in pictures • He dressed up at Comic-Con. He preached to chickens. He's the John Lewis you don't know

item.title: 85 infants under age 1 tested positive for coronavirus in one Texas county
item.description: Eighty-five infants under age 1 have tested positive for coronavirus in one Texas county. And local officials are imploring residents to help stop its spread as the state becomes one of the newest hotspots.

item.title: 'Alarming outbreak' of Covid-19 spreads through law enforcement training facility
item.description: A coronavirus outbreak has spread through a federal law enforcement training facility in South Carolina prompting the national employees union to call for a halt to training.
